info.description:
!D Cloud is an RFID integration platform for retail stores. While we
                                        provide core functionality for retail companies, a lot of functionality can be
                                        added or extended by 3rd party developers. We encourage you to do so!
info.title: !D Cloud API

get.description: This endpoint returns the approved difference list with only one quantity per GTIN: the RFID quantity if the difference for that GTIN has been approved, otherwise the ERP quantity. This endpoint returns all GTINs, even the ones where RFID and ERP quantities are equal.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Approved difference list ID.

parameters.name: include_articles
parameters.description: When set to true the article master data will be included in the response.

parameters.name: accept
parameters.description: Approved difference list ID.

get.summary: List of approved difference list summaries
get.description: Retrieves list of approved difference lists for given location.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: The location identifier for list of approved difference lists.

parameters.name: from_rfid_time
parameters.description:
Defines date+time since when approved difference lists are required.
When omitted: returns all approved difference lists for specified location since the epoch.

parameters.name: until_rfid_time
parameters.description:
Defines date+time until when approved difference lists are required.
When omitted: returns all approved difference lists for specified location up until now.

get.description: Retrieve an approved difference list using the difference list ID. The response contains GTIN, ERP quantity, RFID quantity and an approved flag. This endpoint returns all GTINs, even the ones where RFID and ERP quantities are equal.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Approved difference list ID.

parameters.name: include_articles
parameters.description: When set to true the article master data will be included in the response.

parameters.name: accept
parameters.description: Approved difference list ID.

get.summary: Retrieve the summary an approved difference list
get.description: Returns the summary of an approved difference list for a certain location and RFID time.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: The location identifier for list of approved difference lists.

parameters.name: rfid_time
parameters.description: Date and time of an RFID stock.

post.summary: Update the export status of an approved difference list
post.description: !D Cloud keeps track of the export status of approved difference lists. This endpoint can be used to update the status in !D Cloud.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of approved difference list.

parameters.name: export_status
parameters.description: New export status of approved difference list.

post.description: Create or replace article(s) in !D Cloud. Replacing will happen based on GTIN, which is the primary key.

parameters.name: articles
parameters.description: An array of articles that should be created or replaced.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Search query.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Return this number of articles.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Skip this number of articles. When omitted: skip none.

parameters.name: extern_ref
parameters.description: This can be used to match requests with responses from the server (for example, Ajax requests are asynchronous and thus can return out of sequence).

parameters.name: order[]
parameters.description: Column to which ordering should be applied. When omitted: default order wil be based on score.

get.description: Returns the total number of articles registered in !D Cloud.

Retrieve articles. There are three ways to call this endpoint:
 1) specify gtins,
 2) specify barcodes, or
 3) specify updated_after, skip and count.
 You can not mix these sets: skip and count have no meaning when specifying gtins or barcodes, and combining gtins and updated_after also doesn't work.

parameters.name: gtins[]
parameters.description: The GTIN(s) of which article information should be returned. Repeat key-value for retrieving multiple GTINs. Mutually exclusive with barcodes[] and updated_after.

parameters.name: barcodes[]
parameters.description: The barcode(s) of which article information should be returned. Repeat key-value for retrieving multiple barcodes. Mutually exclusive with gtins[] and updated_after.

parameters.name: updated_after
parameters.description: Articles updated on or after this time. When omitted: return all Article objects since 1 january 1970.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Skip this number of articles. When omitted: skip none.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Return this number of articles. The maximum number of returned articles is limited at 50.000. When omitted: return 100 Article objects.

parameters.name: fields[]
parameters.description:
Which fields should be included in the response. Can be any of the Article fields.
When omitted: all fields will be included in the response.

delete.description: Delete specified articles from the database. This cannot be undone! Please note the articles are not  deleted from the !D Cloud mobile apps. To do that, reset the app and re-register using the QR code.

parameters.name: gtins
parameters.description: GTIN(s) to delete. Repeat key-value for deleting multiple articles. If empty or not specified, all articles are deleted.

delete.description: Delete all articles from the database. This cannot be undone! Please note the articles are not deleted from the !D Cloud mobile apps. To do that, reset the app and re-register using the QR code.

post.summary: Captures and stores EPCIS events in !D Cloud.
post.description: The capture endpoint captures one or more EPCIS events at a time. This does not imply any relationship between these EPCIS events. Each element of the argument list is accepted if it is a valid EPCIS event or subtype that conforms to the above EPCIS event types.

parameters.name: events
parameters.description: An array of EPCISEvent(s) to capture and store.

post.summary: Query and retrieve EPCIS event(s) from !D Cloud.
post.description: Returns a set of EPCIS Events that matches the criteria specified in the query parameters.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Query parameter object. If two or more query parameters are defined, then the AND operation is always applied.

parameters.name: ERP stock
parameters.description: The ERP stock to store.

get.description: Retrieves ERP stock summary list for given location.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: The location for which the stock is defined.

parameters.name: from_event_time
parameters.description: Retrieve the ERP stock summaries from this time.

parameters.name: until_event_time
parameters.description: Retrieve the ERP stock summaries until this time.

get.summary: Retrieve a list of GTINs and quantities for a certain ERP stock.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the ERP stock to retrieve.

parameters.name: with_excluded
parameters.description: Boolean parameter that indicates if we want to include excluded GTINs from ERP stock.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the ERP stock summary to retrieve.

get.description: Retrieve list of RFID counts for a certain location.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: The location to retrieve the count for

parameters.name: from_event_time
parameters.description: Limits the returned list to stocks with an event time after the specified date and time

parameters.name: until_event_time
parameters.description: Limits the returned list to stocks with an event time before the specified date and time

get.description: Retrieve a RFID count based on GTIN and quantity.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: The location to retrieve the count for

parameters.name: gtins[]
parameters.description: Filter by GTIN. When omitted: returns all available GTINs, so no filtering based on GTIN is applied

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: The time of the count to retrieve (relates to the event_time of the count). When omitted: the report will contain the latest available stock information.

parameters.name: include_articles
parameters.description: Include article information in the response.

get.summary: Returns the real time stock at a certain location in unique items (SGTINs). Items are returned based on their last known bizLocation (location) as registered via the EPCIS Capture API.
get.description:
The response contains a list of stocks for all matching (sub)locations based on the given parameters:
* If the stock for a store without sublocations is requested, the stocks list in the response  will contain one entry containing the stock for the entire store. 
* If a store has sublocations, the list of stocks in the response will contain an entry each   for the sublocations.
* If a store has stock for both sublocations and store, the list of stocks in the response   contains entries for the store and the sublocations with stock.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: Location ID of a store or a sublocation.

parameters.name: location_types[]
parameters.description:
Filter on sublocation type(s): only stock on sublocations of the specified type(s) will be returned. Repeat key-value for specifying multiple sublocation types.
Valid sublocation types are:
    STOCK_ROOM, SALES_FLOOR,
    OFFSITE_STORAGE and
    FOREIGN.
Default behavior is to return stocks for all sublocation types except FOREIGN.

get.summary: Returns the real time stock at a certain location per GTIN (and not per unique item).
get.description:
The response contains a list of stocks for all matching sublocations based on the given parameters.
* If the stock for a store without sublocations is requested, the stocks list in the response   will contain one entry containing the stock for the entire store. 
* If a store has sublocations, the list of stocks in the response will contain an entry each   for the sublocations.
* If a store has stock for both sublocations and store, the list of stocks in the response   contains entries for the store and the sublocations with stock.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: Location ID of a store or a sublocation.

parameters.name: location_types[]
parameters.description:
Filter on sublocation type(s): only stock on sublocations of the specified type(s) will be returned. Repeat key-value for specifying multiple sublocation types.
Valid sublocation types are:
    STOCK_ROOM, SALES_FLOOR,
    OFFSITE_STORAGE and
    FOREIGN.
Default behavior is to return stocks for all sublocation types except FOREIGN.

parameters.name: include_articles
parameters.description: Include article information in the response.

get.summary: Returns the real time stock at a certain location in unique items (SGTINs). Items are returned based on their last known bizLocation (location) as registered via the EPCIS Capture API.
get.description:
The response contains a list of stocks for all matching (sub)locations based on the given parameters:
* If the stock for a store without sublocations is requested, the stocks list in the response  will contain one entry containing the stock for the entire store. 
* If a store has sublocations, the list of stocks in the response will contain an entry each   for the sublocations.
* If a store has stock for both sublocations and store, the list of stocks in the response   contains entries for the store and the sublocations with stock.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: Location ID of a store or a sublocation.

parameters.name: location_types[]
parameters.description:
Filter on sublocation type(s): only stock on sublocations of the specified type(s) will be returned. Repeat key-value for specifying multiple sublocation types.
Valid sublocation types are:
    STOCK_ROOM, SALES_FLOOR,
    OFFSITE_STORAGE and
    FOREIGN.
Default behavior is to return stocks for all sublocation types except FOREIGN.

parameters.name: dispositions[]
parameters.description: Filter on disposition(s): only stock of the specified disposition(s) will be returned.

post.summary: Captures and stores a shipment notice in !D Cloud.
post.description: Only shipment notices are allowed. These are represented by the status INTRANSIT.

parameters.name: Shipment notice
parameters.description: Shipment notice to capture.

delete.summary: Deletes a shipment notice from !D Cloud.
delete.description: If the shipment notice was created by an aggregation event, this event will be retracted without a reason.

parameters.name: parent_id
parameters.description: Parent ID of a shipment.

get.summary: Retrieves a list of shipment summaries.
get.description: Either source or destination is required, not both. This endpoint can produce: JSON, CSV and Excel.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: Source of a shipment.

parameters.name: destination
parameters.description: Destination of a shipment.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Status of the shipment.

parameters.name: last_modified_since
parameters.description: Find shipments that have been modified since specified time. When omitted: default is present minus one month.

parameters.name: parent_id
parameters.description: Parent ID of a shipment.

parameters.name: include_articles
parameters.description: When set to true the article master data will be included in the response.

post.summary: Captures and stores workflow events in !D Cloud.
post.description: The capture endpoint captures one workflow events at a time.

parameters.name: WorkflowEvent
parameters.description: A workflow event to capture and store.

get.summary: Query and retrieve workflow event(s) from !D Cloud.
get.description: Returns a set of workflow events that matches the criteria specified in the query parameters.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description:
Identifies location.
When omitted: return all workflow events for all locations.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
Defines the type of the workflow event.
When omitted: return all workflow events for all types.

parameters.name: from_event_time
parameters.description:
Defines date+time since when the counts are required.
When omitted: returns all workflow events for specified location since the epoch.

parameters.name: until_event_time
parameters.description:
Defines date+time until when the counts are required.
 When omitted: returns all workflow events for specified location up until now.

absolute_difference.description: Absolute difference of this difference list in number of items.

gross_difference.description: Gross difference of this difference list as a percentage.

not_on_shelf_gtin_quantity.description: The number of articles (GTINs) that are not available on shelf, but are available in a stock room.

not_on_shelf_percentage.description: Same as above, but as a percentage of the total number of GTINs in the store.

store_quantity.description: The number of items in the entire store.

stock_ratio.description: Percentage of items in the entire store that are in stock rooms.

erp_stock_id.description: ID of ERP stock used to generate the summary.

erp_stock_time.description: Time of ERP stock used to generate the summary.

rfid_stock_time.description: Time of RFID stock used to generate the summary.

erp_quantity.description: Number of items in ERP stock

rfid_quantity.description: Number of items in RFID stock

erp_gtin_quantity.description: Number of GTINs in ERP stock

rfid_gtin_quantity.description: Number of GTINs in RFID stock. The number of articles (GTINs) that are available in the store (including sales floors and stock rooms).

plus_difference.description: Positive difference of this difference list in number of items (where there is more items in rfid count than in erp import).

minus_difference.description: Negative difference of this difference list in number of items (where there is more items in erp import than in rfid count).

stock_rooms_quantity.description: The number of items in all stock rooms.

sales_floors_quantity.description: The number of items in all sales floors.

shipments_in_transit.description: The number of shipments that are in transit

shipments_average_received_percentage.description: The average received percentage over the shipments in the last 10 weeks

id.description: Identifier, unique per organization, that identifies the EPCIS event.

stored_id.description: Identifier, globally unique. Automatically created by !D Cloud when it's stored in !DCloud.

event_id.description:
(Optional) A "globally unique identifier" for this event.
This is used to mark the events as a corrective event for an event which is marked as in error by an ErrorDeclaration.
As this "corrective" event can become erroneous as well, it's not so globally unique.
This is specified in EPCIS-standard-1.2-draft and is not implemented in !DCloud.

event_time.description: The date and time at which the EPCIS Capturing Applications asserts the event occurred. See EPCIS version 1.1

record_time.description: The date and time at which this event was recorded by an EPCIS Repository. If a client adds record_time, it will be overridden by the server. See EPCIS version 1.1

event_time_zone_offset.description: The time zone offset in effect at the time and place the event occurred, expressed as an offset from UTC. Values range from -14:59 to +14:59. See EPCIS version 1.1

ErrorDeclaration.description: A ErrorDeclaration is a structure that identifies a prior EPCISEvent is in error.

QuantityElement.description: A QuantityElement is a structure that identifies a specific quantity of objects identified by a specific class-level identifier.

location.description: The location for which the stock is defined.

event_time.description:
Client-side date+time of registering that the count was finished.
This is not the moment of sending the workflow event nor is it the moment when the last EPC was observed.

start_time.description: Optional. This is moment when the first EPC was observed.

epc_count.description: The total number of EPCs that were counted in the referenced message_ids.

message_ids.description: Array of EPCIS event message IDs. These events contain the actual EPCs that were observed in this count.
